title.narrative: AR APL2 National Highway Asset Mgt

description.narrative: The overall purpose of the program is to further develop and implement an efficient road network management strategy, bringing about the necessary resources to preserve the national road network in the long term. This is a key condition towards increasing the competitiveness of the economy and supporting a sustainable path of economic growth and poverty reduction: a. Preserve the condition of vital road assets, through the gradual expansion of performance-based contracts for the rehabilitation and maintenance of the non-concessioned primary paved network; b. Strengthen road sector management through carrying out a renewal program of DNV to revitalize its role in the sector by: (i) reinforcing its human resource base, (ii) consolidating its transformation into a results-oriented organization accountable for specific outputs; (iii) introducing a systematic approach to bridge management and (iv) enhancing road safety.

condition.narrative: Carry out road and traffic surveys
Create and Mantain specific budget line entries for expenditures under project
Maintain a UCP with structure functions and responsibility accetable to the Bank
Review jointly with Bank the Education Unit Cost

target.value: 4 Technical Schools fully operational with more than 400 students promoted each year

comment.narrative: Target will not be met - only 7 bridges will be rehabilitated. Three of these are under contract, another 2 bridges brought tosignature

title.narrative: Implementation of a comprehensive results- oriented road maintenance program balancing efficiency, equity and regional development considerations, through the expansion of CREMA system.

comment.narrative: Additional 1,200 Km under tender and another 1,550 scheduled to be tendered by end of the year.

About 65% of total length of Bank-financed CREMA contracts (3335 km) is expected to be rehabilitated. In addition some 7,600 kmofCREMA are to be financed with local funds, of which about 4,900 km are expected to be rehabilitated.
